document.title: Content Standards and Grade Level Expectations English Program 2022

C6FE8BCA5D8C411DB289A7E3E09FAE87.description:
Acquire and accurately use grade-appropriate general, academic, and content-specific words and phrases, including those that signal contrast, addition, and other logical relationships (e.g., however, although, nevertheless, similarity,
moreover, in addition).

94FFE7AFE3EE49DAB42B48C624CB4A56.description:
Accurately use a variety of social, academic, and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and
listening at the college and career-readiness level.

46FD161F408A4DAC961A5D1C44F2C73B.description:
Apply coordinating conjunctions (e.g., and, but, for, nor, or, so) to illustrate subtle differences in
meaning.

FF1D40C8EBCD4110928B25B553A57F46.description:
Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to
better understand each of the words.

AA3B45484A4D499FBB58A80554AB0DF2.description: Recognize and explain common idioms, sayings, and proverbs.

16746D7521BB489E8695205BCBCCD890.description: Analyze and use figurative language, including similes and metaphors, appropriately.

533F1D46A64E494CACED543F4B1BECE9.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

52E85F81F23445FE845E96912AE1AAA8.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

E6E76EBD69BD4F5E8CEB3A4FD3FD65E2.description: Consult both digital and print reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauri) to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

15163B33344944A3933DABB2D0CCDB18.description: Use common Greek and Latin affixes and other etymologies to help determine the meaning of a word (e.g., telegraph/photograph/autograph).

B12041C19F50400CAA5B1FEEBAFE6374.description: Use context clues and other strategies to help determine word meaning.

27E42AEEBCF44182AB485E22F94DC97F.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on developmentally appropriate reading and content, choosing flexibly from a variety of strategies.

7E1B8B058F7D46748267828DE9EAAA4D.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and
consulting reference materials.

96D987E0203343129E88552EC9D03D65.description: Choose words and phrases to convey ideas precisely.

7DD1A6CF965D440893CD661130429E74.description: Demonstrate knowledge of correct language usage when writing, speaking, or reading.

FB115E4AD3E94BBBB5085138F297724D.description:
Demonstrate understanding of how language functions in different contexts, making effective choices for meaning, style, and
comprehension.

18529C6AF1774047913863875D324A59.description: Spell words correctly, consulting reference materials such as dictionaries as needed.

884DA0F9B33D4545AB95641C6C6E722E.description: Demonstrate command of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions when writing.

DBBDE25B93C6444BA07F0F5E24343B7D.description: Apply appropriate English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions.

FC6128CD63E64D8D84D8138AE0A501F2.description: Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate fragments and run-ons.

FE0686BBF4BF4434AF65AB429F1647BB.description: Use conjunctions in writing and speech (e.g., and, but, for, nor, or, so).

480B236D6902453BA4B4795E1CA75D29.description: Correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.

C0E967440302494FB3827F7423FFD1CB.description: Apply knowledge of subject-verb agreement to write and speak effectively.

6665839779194E6D8C6B0982C47D9E97.description:
Apply appropriate verb tenses to convey various times, sequences, states, and conditions. Use
linking and helping verbs.

C599B5C3AA0E4AB5A486E3628520FB1F.description:
Form and appropriately use the perfect verb tenses (e.g., I had walked. / I have walked. / I will
have walked.).

32E264C5991D42E69DEBFB885D8C978D.description: Use and explain the function of prepositions correctly in general and specific sentences.

8C4DE59CB5BE46ACB01F7F2AA3DF7198.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions when writing or speaking.

733D62623BB24A5F930104C3C61AA4D3.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

1FA8B638C55F4A818D97008DA16EF453.description:
Write routinely over extended periods of time (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter periods of
time (a single sitting or 1–2 days) for a variety of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

4D5ADE87933E44A2975BBF918DEE0337.description: Write routinely over short and extended periods of time for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

57CE8C4698164809922F77CA7BD3DA8F.description: Draw evidence from literary and informational texts to reflect understanding and research in writing.

4FBB65649DE044A98C2268E1C2FCB520.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

82E4E647096C49838641AC28EFAE6469.description: Using multiple sources, participate in or conduct research to gather information that answers a question about a single topic.

0D30CB73C67B42E189D84F2DB5E466B8.description: With increasing independence, conduct short research projects that build knowledge on a topic.

FDF9E699C7BC411F88024E5B1C225CA1.description: Conduct research projects of varying lengths based on focused questions to demonstrate understanding of the subject.

272B33F0B33149549A6A4ABC4C080230.description: Use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

90190AE02A0840438B8D0F3FB8A85A27.description: Use technology, including the internet, to interact and collaborate with others and produce and publish writing.

E92C6EC34F0B42749094B355C962DE1A.description: Use digital tools to produce and publish writing individually or with peers.

D07A0B83908C485687AF49438B4EC167.description:
Improve writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing with guidance and support from
adults and feedback from peers.

E7A4D24D641C410795D26E0C9149B687.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing. Apply appropriate sentence structure
and word order.

9035AFAD280A46E19372BAC12E04C532.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, rewriting, and
publishing).

F700CA83E02A4EF1BF68857660FD5449.description:
Use transitional words and other cohesive devices to better organize writing in paragraphs of 5
or more sentences. (Include 5 or more words per sentence.)

794F61847BCF4CA4B764387C84DC9FF5.description: Write descriptive paragraphs to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

51B1A43A3FE4457D8935287FFFC39EA0.description: Write literary texts to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, details, and structure.

03FC94669AC84EF187BC6097B7681EFF.description:
Write longer informational texts to examine a topic and convey ideas collaboratively and with increasing independence using appropriate text organization in paragraphs of 5 or more sentences. (Include 5 or more words
per sentence.)

E8F04141F8AF49EFA189EF509BFBAB94.description:
Write informational texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the selection,
organization, and analysis of relevant content.

2423548F5F0340ADA4A376098EB77C44.description: Balance statements with modal verbal expressions that show mood or uncertainty (e.g., can, could, would, should, will, etc.).

181BCCECE47148509E84ED949AE20B31.description:
Support opinions or persuade others by expressing appropriate/accurate reasoning and using some textual evidence or relevant background knowledge on the content in paragraphs of 5 or more sentences. (Include 5 or
more words per sentence.)

AEE55CE47728414BA7592C0BA2205732.description: Write arguments to support point of view using valid reasoning and relevant evidence.

244303664EB14EBD9C7E5779C1AB4D35.description:
Read and comprehend literature from Puerto Rico and other cultures (e.g., stories, dramas, and poetry) and
informational texts (e.g., history, social studies, science, and technical texts) of appropriate complexity.

4D0F34549DB44F6EB2152A12F73AF116.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

0A9E909B47FD46DA82F79871F40D80D2.description:
Integrate information from 2 informational texts on the same topic in order to write or speak
about the subject knowledgeably.

27205A53883349BCBF9CFB5B55B59339.description:
Compare and contrast the treatment of similar themes and topics (e.g., opposition of good and evil) and patterns of events (e.g., the quest) in stories, myths, and traditional literature from
different cultures.

08A9274D8C84481282733E381C1A6CB1.description: Compare and contrast 2 or more authors’ presentations of similar themes or topics.

FDE2C9AF36F540CD8A0EB14303E0A72F.description:
Identify how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, including, but not limited
to, narrative, persuasive, and descriptive writing and knowledge of their qualities.

68D4E55A164E4C15B68267007FA08A9A.description: Delineate and evaluate an author’s argument through evidence specified in a text.

7D492E9CC4B04E5A8158DBC69D598C39.description:
Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams,
timelines, animations, or interactive elements on web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the informational text in which it appears.

E31AB69904984DFBB380EA4DDAC8F18A.description:
Make connections between the text of a story or drama and a visual or oral presentation of the
text, identifying where each version reflects specific descriptions and directions in the text.

81914CC7D2354077A4AEC770D9F61BB7.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats.

11D862B998404AFEA26CB826F45E990D.description: Compare and contrast the same event or topic in different informational texts. Describe the differences and focus on the information provided.

8982F64E52B744A2936EC0B8780FEBBA.description: Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first- and third-person narrations.

47EF328373024D1A88A5A1D19F9372FA.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

6B322A5AE85F456A8887DF345279F67E.description:
Explain how the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in an informational text relate to
each other and to the whole.

172E37927840465BBECE21D4A14FA479.description: Identify and explain how text features determine meaning in a literary text.

63C7C61FCDD447EEB5488A775654AA75.description:
Identify and explain major differences between poetry, drama, and prose. Refer to the structural elements of poetry (e.g., verse, rhythm, meter) and drama (e.g., casts of characters,
settings, descriptions, dialogue, stage directions) when writing or speaking about a literary text.

E0807A2DFD3E4446BB4F3386336F9330.description: Analyze the structure of a text, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., sections, chapters, scenes, or stanzas) relate to each other and to the whole.

26403A397858477EB26744AD19F0AC0B.description: Determine the meaning of general, academic, and content-specific words or phrases in an informational text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

AE51435D65B04AE1B4BCCDFD7EECAC3F.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a literary text, including connotative and figurative meanings.

B4F71F4888CF4740B76B9A305CCF65E6.description:
Recognize and explain the meaning of words and phrases in context and distinguish literal from
figurative language.

863D71FC83D54DF8B32E57952DC9CBD9.description:
Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings. Analyze
how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

4AE183704E1E450CB67F1E5E7E13DE68.description: Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text, including what happened and why, based on specific information in the text.

AB1928C52FDF4C7AB24228A899FDE68D.description:
Describe a character, setting, or event from a story or drama in depth, drawing on specific details
in the text (e.g., a character’s thoughts, words, or actions).

06F40F99F18145E5B5F8E9D1D5066EB1.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

85A5923ADE5B4E53899DC24D1C93D1A7.description:
Determine the main idea of an informational text and explain how it is supported by key details.
Summarize the text.

4BC2E8DC202142C8B10E36EB603DC735.description: Determine a theme from a story, drama, or poem from details in the text. Summarize the text.

5A910CF9AB6B4E068C98EF4430647074.description: Determine main ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development. Summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

DB5E1C32AF6343309932A786137E99A9.description: Identify facts/details that support main idea(s) from the texts.

276E5BBFCE7A4A9580622D79E3441C4C.description:
Explicitly refer to details in a text when explaining what the text says and when drawing
inferences from the text.

3ED4998B6DE140BB83B64BD5E4B02C54.description:
Use in-depth critical reading of a variety of relevant texts and genres and viewing of multimedia resources (when accessible) to explain and evaluate main ideas, phenomena, processes, cultural identities, and relationships and to
express inferences and conclusions, quoting accurately from a text.

79C2A0E777E341CB8CF9480566418BA6.description: Read critically to make logical inferences and cite specific textual evidence to support conclusions drawn from the text.

022BA875120149DF8E60DDAE5F82425F.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

DB5547E95E7240D193B1504560D812B5.description:
Accurately read on-level prose and poetry orally with appropriate rate and expression on
successive readings.

5EB654EDB9684DFE9DF529B010832945.description: Read on-level texts with purpose and understanding.

34085B798F044713A9C00E660923A249.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

4F38C0EE2F04400783011ACA1A652C7C.description:
Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology (e.g., base words, roots, and affixes) to accurately read unfamiliar multisyllabic
words in and out of context.

C88821215675454DBE81320ED87FC10C.description:
Understand and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to decode short and long sound patterns and
their variants both in isolation and in text.

379A1ACE36624CB0A4E84D575BABF533.description:
Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in spoken
monosyllabic words.

92C3B1D1F81D4B2085AAA3A3DB09356C.description:
Segment spoken monosyllabic words into their complete sequence of individual sounds
(phonemes).

72748952A7E04560B2872092E6EDD2B4.description: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken monosyllabic words.

4153C46ABED94EF6919FF80A8DEDE3A6.description:
Manipulate sounds and words in shared, guided, and independent activities, such as singing,
read-alouds, or chants.

531098DACFD447BEA153B7CABB2ACF4E.description:
Decode monosyllabic and multisyllabic words as appropriate to the student’s communication
modality.

A8C9A11389EE4FABB5F5AD956FB055AD.description: Accurately segment monosyllabic and multisyllabic words.

1834D7F80D4D4309A0E1CA1FE3E66B07.description: Orally produce monosyllabic and multisyllabic words by accurately blending sounds.

BBCF4E3DB291476E90C119F31D092F95.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

315B08AB69F2479B892C2C2BCE869906.description: Phonological awareness (rhyming, blending, segmentation, deletion, isolation, substitution)

9B02023F7BF94369A65A7220B8F4A885.description: Provide basic reference information of source(s).

62399E2AE683481D931DC1828269731B.description: Cite or paraphrase data and conclusions from other sources avoiding plagiarism.

7C3A9DF111084D89862381766942A5A5.description: Recognize and gather relevant information from multiple reliable print and digital sources.

B887826E16AA4377899471C8EA95B40A.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

AAF5F7A789274CF6AA9DBEDE4A0042A8.description:
Explain a report on a current event or recount a memorable experience with increasing
sophistication.

D0A1F3AC6AB742FB82552BFF27369073.description:
Paraphrase texts and recount experiences using complete sentences, key words, and a growing number of general, academic, and content‐specific words in order to communicate
with increasing precision.

03758524C9C047E2A2000F17457E497D.description: Plan and deliver oral presentations on a variety of topics and content areas using details and evidence to support ideas (e.g., integrating print or technological/digital resources).

70E918AEAF82467E974B419FB2886D12.description:
Plan and deliver different types of oral presentations/reports to express information and support ideas in social, academic,
college, and career settings.

8F9F7EF58FB14D2496F360987FB99D64.description:
Describe and explain experiences, ideas, and concepts using appropriate grammar and vocabulary according to
the task and audience.

7533B48EF40A40169CA926618ACDB115.description: Adjust language choices according to the task, context, purpose, and audience.

C845E780B65E41D294EBC89F66F5E10E.description:
Negotiate with or persuade others in conversations using grade-appropriate vocabulary and open responses to
provide counterarguments.

3B2B8B12594248D1971BB61FC46B34F5.description: Provide, justify, and defend opinions or positions in speech.

EB2258055ADF4D87B081B13EA6C7BDB9.description: Use appropriate academic vocabulary, including homonyms, synonyms, and grammatically correct language, to discuss experiences and texts.

1F4090AF6A59449F900A0B79981C1C20.description: Contribute to social, academic, college, and career conversations using accurate and appropriate language.

D04331F7BB284F8FB34486B152A5B469.description:
Expand and enrich sentences to provide details about a familiar or new activity, process, or
academic concept.

725022DF476440B5B39F14B2D9C1BF25.description: Express self using correct simple and compound sentences.

3F7B6E4051A049FFA8570C70295D3423.description: Answer and formulate closed- and open-ended questions in formal and informal discussions.

B6A0EF3935BA4CD6AD857DA5F4465981.description: Evaluate information and determine appropriate responses to answer questions effectively.

9EFE20CA8792429085697B1EB1AC9D5E.description: Contribute to class, group, and partner discussions by following rules, asking and answering questions, and adding relevant information.

3C7B30DB8B574CF8B786B59C9A883CCB.description:
Contribute to discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics in diverse contexts and with different
audiences.

9D187216DA494EC780FA0371F96A8D53.description:
Listen and respond to a variety of literary and informational texts during read-alouds to identify
and understand the main idea and details in texts.

119AB085CD4F4E19915F6A8EACD353FF.description:
Listen to, memorize, and respond to complex instructions, expressing self and using complete
sentences.

710290316AE147EEB2DF4ABB02F68E03.description: Interact in a socially appropriate manner.

049CCBD814834A69B6D53A81B4A4D763.description:
Listen attentively, stay focused, ask/answer detailed questions, and express appropriate reasoning about personal experiences and texts. Use complete sentences and correct grammar
to express opinions or clarify positions.

567F82F0B0384D0095693996B51E60B5.description: Listen to and interact with peers during group participation and oral presentations.

7F5D3F7C26FE4763B0ECAA90258EA1E0.description:
Comprehend and analyze information from a variety of listening activities to ask and answer questions on social, academic,
college, and career topics.
